text: Cerianthidae is a family of tube-dwelling anemones in the order Spirularia of the subclass Ceriantharia. ==Genera== The World Register of Marine Species includes the following genera in the family: * Anthoactis Leloup, 1932 * Apiactis Beneden, 1897 * Bursanthus Leloup, 1968 * Ceriantheomorphe Carlgren, 1931 * Ceriantheopsis Carlgren, 1912 * Cerianthus Delle Chiaje, 1830 * Engodactylactis Leloup, 1942 * Isodactylactis Carlgren, 1924 * Nautanthus Leloup, 1964 * Pachycerianthus Roule, 1904 * Paradactylactis Carlgren, 1924 * Parovactis Leloup, 1964 * Peponactis Van Beneden, 1897 * Plesiodactylactis Leloup, 1942 * Sacculactis Leloup, 1964 * Solasteractis Van Beneden, 1897 * Synarachnactis Carlgren, 1924 * Syndactylactis Carlgren, 1924 * Trichactis Leloup, 1964 ==References==
title: Cerianthidae
